kpis.description: Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) score measures the total cost of acquiring a new customer, including marketing expenses, sales expenses, and any other costs associated with the acquisition process.
kpis.formula: CAC = Total Sales and Marketing Expenses / Number of New Customers Acquired

kpis.description: Return on Investment (ROI) measures the profitability of an investment relative to its cost. It is used to evaluate the efficiency of an investment or compare the efficiency of several investments.
kpis.formula: ROI = (Net Profit from Investment / Cost of Investment) * 100

kpis.description: Conversion rate is the percentage of visitors or leads that take a desired action, such as making a purchase or signing up for a service. It is a key metric for assessing the effectiveness of marketing efforts.
kpis.formula: Conversion Rate = (Number of Conversions / Total Visitors or Leads) * 100

kpis.description: Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) is the total revenue a business can expect from a single customer account throughout the business relationship. It helps businesses understand how much they can spend on acquiring customers.
kpis.formula: CLV = Average Purchase Value * Average Purchase Frequency Rate * Average Customer Lifespan

kpis.description: The CLV to CAC ratio compares the lifetime value of a customer to the cost of acquiring that customer. A higher ratio indicates a more profitable customer acquisition strategy.
kpis.formula: CLV to CAC Ratio = CLV / CAC
